titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. Social time ‚Äì We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections. Generous health insurance for US employees and their familiesEquity for all full-time rolesRead More About The Team:Shape Up vs Scrum: 6 Months to 6 Weeks ‚Äì How We Cut Our Dev Cycle 75%The Inside Secrets of a Process Street Full Stack EngineerAn Insider Look Into How We Built the Process Street Slack App (In 2 Weeks!)

titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. Social time ‚Äì We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections. Generous health insurance for US employees and their familiesEquity for all full-time rolesRead More About The Team:Shape Up vs Scrum: 6 Months to 6 Weeks ‚Äì How We Cut Our Dev Cycle 75%The Inside Secrets of a Process Street Full Stack EngineerAn Insider Look Into How We Built the Process Street Slack App (In 2 Weeks!)

descripcion_puesto: Job Summary:RoverPass, a fast-growing startup that helps campgrounds and RV parks attract more customers, is seeking a Jr. Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate should be skilled in SQL, BI reporting, and Looker studio or similar tools, with a good understanding of big data. Knowledge in Python is a plus. The Jr. Data Analyst will be responsible for creating, updating, and optimizing SQL scripts, creating and updating BI reports, ensuring data quality, and communicating with customers to understand their data-related needs.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RaycWHRyof8Responsibilities:Develop and maintain SQL scripts to retrieve, analyze, and visualize data for various business needsCreate and update BI reports using Looker studio or similar toolsMonitor and ensure data quality by identifying data discrepancies and collaborating with the team to resolve themCollaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and propose solutions for data-related issuesWork closely with customers to understand their data needs and develop custom reportsKeep up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques and implement them as neededAssist senior data analysts with complex data analysis projectsRequirement:Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or MathematicsProficient in SQL and BI reporting tools such as Looker studio or similarFamiliarity with big data technologies and conceptsExperience with Python is a plusStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent English communication skillsAbility to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environmentDetail-oriented with a focus on delivering accurate and reliable resultsIf you are passionate about data analysis and want to be a part of a small and dynamic team that is changing the game for campgrounds and RV parks, apply now to join RoverPass as a Jr. Data AnalystWhat do we offer?Flexible Working Hours ü§∏üèª‚è∞100% remote work üè°Competitive USD salary ü§©Paid Time Off / vacations üí™üèªüèùLocal Holidays üóìPaid Maternity/Paternity Leave üê£

Were Kuona (kuona.ai), an Artificial Intelligence technology company that empowers consumer products and retailers to live up to their revenue goals and empowers our clients to maximize their sales and profitability through the dynamic optimization of prices, promotions, and inventories. Our AI-powered platform helps top brands like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and Nutrioli to maximize their profits and optimize inventories. We are looking for people that are world-class, curious, innovative, bright, and work to be better every single day!The function of a Business Analytics Analyst is to collaborate with different departments across the organization to develop insights based on our client ÃÅs data. Is responsible for analyzing data and generating valuable insights that enable clients to make data-driven decisions using integrated tools and improve their performance in key areas of the business. Identify and prioritize business problems and opportunities and develop robust business hypotheses and analyses, prepare recommendations for business cases and presentations for both our internal team and our end clients. In addition to aiding in the identification of patterns and trends, report generation, and collaboration with other teams to implement solutions and improvements in processes, methodologies, statistical techniques, mathematics, and programming. This is a fully remote position, however, we do have voluntary-hybrid work for people located in Monterrey, NL.Key Responsibilities:Perform data analysis using analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, or other similar tools.Identify patterns and trends in data to generate insights and recommendations that can be used for business decision-making.Collaborate with other teams, such as Customer Success, Project Managers, Data Science, and Data Engineers, to implement data-driven solutions and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of company operations.Develop predictive and statistical analysis models to identify improvement opportunities and anticipate sales trends.Generate clear and effective reports and presentations to communicate data analysis results to different audiences, both orally and in writing.Monitor and evaluate the impact of implemented actions and propose adjustments or improvements based on the results obtained.Stay updated on the latest trends and tools in the field of data analysis and propose the adoption of new methodologies or technologies that can enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis in the company.Requirements:BA/BS University degree in Engineering, Economics, Finance and Actuary. 3+ years in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Strategic Planning (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or Data Consultant (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years of experience with pricing strategy, channel pricing, price metrics, and elasticity analysis. Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R. Analytical and Problem-Solving skillsExcellent presentation and communication skillsTeamwork and Leadership skillsEnglish spoken and writtenYour experience with Kuona:Creativity: We like that all team members can propose and create new featuresOpportunities to learn: We offer all our employees a wide opportunity to learn things that you probably wouldn't be exposed to in a corporate environment.High Impact: You will be involved in the growth and evolution of the company, and all your contributions will be of high impact on the overall results.We value our culture: We are fully committed to prioritizing great results for our clients and an amazing employee experience for our people.Our process:This is our basic process, we may add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.Introductory screening call with someone from our recruiting team.Interview loop with additional team members, with the following panel:Technical interview for the roleIndustry knowledge and management experienceCulture fit and behavioral interview with our CEOReference ChecksSuccessful candidates will subsequently be made an offer.Kuona provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Were Kuona (kuona.ai), an Artificial Intelligence technology company that empowers consumer products and retailers to live up to their revenue goals and empowers our clients to maximize their sales and profitability through the dynamic optimization of prices, promotions, and inventories. Our AI-powered platform helps top brands like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and Nutrioli to maximize their profits and optimize inventories. We are looking for people that are world-class, curious, innovative, bright, and work to be better every single day!The function of a Business Analytics Analyst is to collaborate with different departments across the organization to develop insights based on our client ÃÅs data. Is responsible for analyzing data and generating valuable insights that enable clients to make data-driven decisions using integrated tools and improve their performance in key areas of the business. Identify and prioritize business problems and opportunities and develop robust business hypotheses and analyses, prepare recommendations for business cases and presentations for both our internal team and our end clients. In addition to aiding in the identification of patterns and trends, report generation, and collaboration with other teams to implement solutions and improvements in processes, methodologies, statistical techniques, mathematics, and programming. This is a fully remote position, however, we do have voluntary-hybrid work for people located in Monterrey, NL.Key Responsibilities:Perform data analysis using analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, or other similar tools.Identify patterns and trends in data to generate insights and recommendations that can be used for business decision-making.Collaborate with other teams, such as Customer Success, Project Managers, Data Science, and Data Engineers, to implement data-driven solutions and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of company operations.Develop predictive and statistical analysis models to identify improvement opportunities and anticipate sales trends.Generate clear and effective reports and presentations to communicate data analysis results to different audiences, both orally and in writing.Monitor and evaluate the impact of implemented actions and propose adjustments or improvements based on the results obtained.Stay updated on the latest trends and tools in the field of data analysis and propose the adoption of new methodologies or technologies that can enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis in the company.Requirements:BA/BS University degree in Engineering, Economics, Finance and Actuary. 3+ years in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Strategic Planning (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or Data Consultant (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years of experience with pricing strategy, channel pricing, price metrics, and elasticity analysis. Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R. Analytical and Problem-Solving skillsExcellent presentation and communication skillsTeamwork and Leadership skillsEnglish spoken and writtenYour experience with Kuona:Creativity: We like that all team members can propose and create new featuresOpportunities to learn: We offer all our employees a wide opportunity to learn things that you probably wouldn't be exposed to in a corporate environment.High Impact: You will be involved in the growth and evolution of the company, and all your contributions will be of high impact on the overall results.We value our culture: We are fully committed to prioritizing great results for our clients and an amazing employee experience for our people.Our process:This is our basic process, we may add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.Introductory screening call with someone from our recruiting team.Interview loop with additional team members, with the following panel:Technical interview for the roleIndustry knowledge and management experienceCulture fit and behavioral interview with our CEOReference ChecksSuccessful candidates will subsequently be made an offer.Kuona provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. Social time ‚Äì We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections. Generous health insurance for US employees and their familiesEquity for all full-time rolesRead More About The Team:Shape Up vs Scrum: 6 Months to 6 Weeks ‚Äì How We Cut Our Dev Cycle 75%The Inside Secrets of a Process Street Full Stack EngineerAn Insider Look Into How We Built the Process Street Slack App (In 2 Weeks!)

Were Kuona (kuona.ai), an Artificial Intelligence technology company that empowers consumer products and retailers to live up to their revenue goals and empowers our clients to maximize their sales and profitability through the dynamic optimization of prices, promotions, and inventories. Our AI-powered platform helps top brands like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and Nutrioli to maximize their profits and optimize inventories. We are looking for people that are world-class, curious, innovative, bright, and work to be better every single day!The function of a Business Analytics Analyst is to collaborate with different departments across the organization to develop insights based on our client ÃÅs data. Is responsible for analyzing data and generating valuable insights that enable clients to make data-driven decisions using integrated tools and improve their performance in key areas of the business. Identify and prioritize business problems and opportunities and develop robust business hypotheses and analyses, prepare recommendations for business cases and presentations for both our internal team and our end clients. In addition to aiding in the identification of patterns and trends, report generation, and collaboration with other teams to implement solutions and improvements in processes, methodologies, statistical techniques, mathematics, and programming. This is a fully remote position, however, we do have voluntary-hybrid work for people located in Monterrey, NL.Key Responsibilities:Perform data analysis using analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, or other similar tools.Identify patterns and trends in data to generate insights and recommendations that can be used for business decision-making.Collaborate with other teams, such as Customer Success, Project Managers, Data Science, and Data Engineers, to implement data-driven solutions and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of company operations.Develop predictive and statistical analysis models to identify improvement opportunities and anticipate sales trends.Generate clear and effective reports and presentations to communicate data analysis results to different audiences, both orally and in writing.Monitor and evaluate the impact of implemented actions and propose adjustments or improvements based on the results obtained.Stay updated on the latest trends and tools in the field of data analysis and propose the adoption of new methodologies or technologies that can enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis in the company.Requirements:BA/BS University degree in Engineering, Economics, Finance and Actuary. 3+ years in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Strategic Planning (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or Data Consultant (preferably in CGPs or Retail), or3+ years of experience with pricing strategy, channel pricing, price metrics, and elasticity analysis. Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R. Analytical and Problem-Solving skillsExcellent presentation and communication skillsTeamwork and Leadership skillsEnglish spoken and writtenYour experience with Kuona:Creativity: We like that all team members can propose and create new featuresOpportunities to learn: We offer all our employees a wide opportunity to learn things that you probably wouldn't be exposed to in a corporate environment.High Impact: You will be involved in the growth and evolution of the company, and all your contributions will be of high impact on the overall results.We value our culture: We are fully committed to prioritizing great results for our clients and an amazing employee experience for our people.Our process:This is our basic process, we may add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.Introductory screening call with someone from our recruiting team.Interview loop with additional team members, with the following panel:Technical interview for the roleIndustry knowledge and management experienceCulture fit and behavioral interview with our CEOReference ChecksSuccessful candidates will subsequently be made an offer.Kuona provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. Social time ‚Äì We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections. Generous health insurance for US employees and their familiesEquity for all full-time rolesRead More About The Team:Shape Up vs Scrum: 6 Months to 6 Weeks ‚Äì How We Cut Our Dev Cycle 75%The Inside Secrets of a Process Street Full Stack EngineerAn Insider Look Into How We Built the Process Street Slack App (In 2 Weeks!)

titulo_puesto: Senior Data Analyst | No-Code SaaS | 100% Remote
descripcion_puesto: Who we are:Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!The Opportunity:You will be Process Street's first in-house data analyst. As a Data Analyst at Process Street, you will play a critical role in driving the company's growth and success. Your main responsibility will be to understand the business and provide insights that will help shape the company's strategic objectives, product direction, growth goals, and retention strategies.You will be responsible for producing insights using data analysis techniques such as performance drivers, retention analysis, and behavioral personas to help grow the business. Additionally, you will evangelize data analysis throughout the organization by using storytelling and creating easy-to-consume media to make complex data insights accessible to all stakeholders. You will partner with key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools and dashboards that assess the impact and improve decision-making.Finally, you will expand the data culture within the organization by building new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes to ensure that data is at the forefront of all decision-making processes.Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!What you'll do:Understand Process Street's business and data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives. Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc. Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on. Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business. Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance. Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making. Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes. What you bring to the table:You have at least 4 years of experience in an analytical role, and you're comfortable with all aspects of data analysis. You've worked in a B2B SaaS company before, and you understand how to navigate self-serve and sales-led motions. You have hands-on experience building charts using BI Tools, writing SQL queries, and you're familiar with SQL and relational databases. You have a talent for telling stories with data, and you're skilled at distilling complex information into actionable insights that drive results. You know how to collect, clean, and analyze data, and you have an eye for identifying patterns and trends that others might miss. You're adept at data manipulation and cleaning, and you know how to ensure the accuracy and precision of analysis results. You have excellent communication skills, and you can effectively communicate complex data analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations. You have a keen eye for spotting errors, inconsistencies, and anomalies in data, and you always make sure that analysis results are accurate and precise. You're a team player, and you enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Engineers, Product Managers, and the company leadership team. You're skilled at detecting patterns and turning them into a strategy that helps the business succeed. These skills are a plus:You are familiar with AARRR(Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, Revenue). You have advanced skills in SQL working with complex queries and data manipulation. You have experience working with data warehouses, and you know how build data pipelines to extract and analyze data from large-scale databases and multiple data sources. You have experience working with one or more of the following tools: Metabase, SnowFlake, Census, dbt, Stitch, FiveTran, and AWS S3. You're always up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data warehousing, and you're passionate about using these tools to drive results for the business. Our Benefits:Fully remote team ‚Äì No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!Unlimited PTO policy ‚Äì Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December. Annual company offsite ‚Äì We get together as a whole company annually as well as encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world. Social time ‚Äì We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections. Generous health insurance for US employees and their familiesEquity for all full-time rolesRead More About The Team:Shape Up vs Scrum: 6 Months to 6 Weeks ‚Äì How We Cut Our Dev Cycle 75%The Inside Secrets of a Process Street Full Stack EngineerAn Insider Look Into How We Built the Process Street Slack App (In 2 Weeks!)

descripcion_puesto: En Mercado Libre estamos democratizando el comercio, el dinero y los pagos en Am√©rica Latina. About IndigoIndigoAg is a mission-driven company dedicated to harnessing nature to help farmers sustainably feed the planet. We innovate across a breadth of technology and science disciplines to help enhance agriculture's long-term sustainability and profitability and mitigate the climate crisis.
